meanings.definition: Excessively concerned with modesty or propriety
meanings.sent1: She always wears long skirts and high-necked blouses, showing her prudish nature.
meanings.sent2: The prudish lady blushed at the sight of the revealing outfit.
meanings.sent3: The prudish librarian gasped when she saw the book with a slightly risque cover.
meanings.sent4: Her prudish attitude was like a shield against any hint of impropriety.
meanings.sent5: The prudish neighbor scolded the kids for playing too loudly, claiming it was indecent.

meanings.definition: Showing disapproval of anything regarded as improper
meanings.sent1: His prudish expression made it clear he disapproved of the rowdy behavior.
meanings.sent2: The prudish teacher frowned upon the use of slang in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The prudish cat gave a disapproving look when the dog started barking loudly.
meanings.sent4: The prudish judge's gaze was like a silent reprimand to the unruly defendant.
meanings.sent5: Her prudish tone conveyed her strong disapproval of the inappropriate joke.
